author: Adrian Zorzut
title: Natural History and Science museums' security guards threaten strike action
text:
Security guards at London's Science and Natural History museums are threatening to strike over what they describe as a “disrespectful and demoralising” pay offer, their union has said.
The workers are being balloted on whether to take industrial action, starting next month.
The United Voices of the World (UVW) union said the latest offer of £13.15 an hour by their employer, security contractor Wilson James, was “too little, too late”.
Wilson James, the firm to which both museums have outsourced their security services, said it highly valued its employees and remained dedicated to finding a solution to the dispute.
A UVW spokesperson said the pay offer was below last year's inflation rate.
The guards, who are asking for £16 an hour, currently earn £11.95 an hour and are not eligible for sick pay until the fourth day of the absence.
They are also demanding more annual leave and compassionate leave.
'Hard to make ends meet' If the ballot approves industrial action, guards would strike on an intermittent basis between 21 October and 3 April.
Science Museum security guard Catherine Campbell said: “I feel demoralised and sad that I’ve not had a proper pay rise.
“I’ve been a security guard for 13 years here and I’m also a fully trained first aider…This can be stressful to deal with. I am always happy to help and do my best but I believe this level of responsibility should be reflected in my salary."
Her colleague Bayo Owolabi said: "The rising cost of rent, energy, groceries, and transport has made it hard to make ends meet.”
Kingsley Ampofo, a security guard at the Natural History Museum, said he had to work overtime to make ends meet.
Google The Science Museum is one of the most-visited attractions in London UVW general secretary Petros Elia said many of the guards, who are mainly migrant workers, protected millions of visitors every year and should not be the lowest paid at the museums.
Mr Elia said the museums’ decision to outsource its security work made guards feel like “second-class workers” and he is calling for the service to be brought back in house.
A Wilson James spokesperson said: “We are actively engaged in conversations with our colleagues and formally recognised trade union representatives at the Science Museum and Natural History Museum and remain dedicated to seeking an effective pay resolution.”
The Science Museum and the Natural History Museum referred the Local Democracy Reporting Service to to Wilson James’s statement.
Listen to the best of BBC Radio London on Sounds and follow BBC London on Facebook , X and Instagram . Send your story ideas to hello.bbclondon@bbc.co.uk

author: Jechikson
title: Gateway at Wynwood Office Buildings Facing $102 Foreclosure Suit
text:
Gateway at Wynwood Office Buildings Facing $102 Foreclosure Suit
By
Julia Echikson March 21, 2024 6:40 pm
reprints
Could the office malaise be coming to Miami? The Gateway at Wynwood, a new Miami office building that welcomed migrating tech and finance firms, is facing foreclosure.
Wilmington Trust, acting on behalf of a commercial mortgage-backed security (CMBS) trust, is suing the owner, R&B Realty Group, in Miami-Dade Court to recoup $101.7 million and seize the 14-story office property. Thorofare, Peak Rock Team Up on $40M Financing for East Texas Industrial Properties
Just over a year ago, A10 Capital
provided $113 million to refinance the 418,337-square-foot building, which features 195,000 square feet of office space, about 25,000 square feet of retail, and 512 parking spots. The A10 Capital loan was later collateralized into a CMBS deal.
The New York-based R&B Realty completed the complex in 2021, touting its Wynwood location to new-to-market tenants arriving in South Florida in the wake of the COVID pandemic. The company had bought the 1.1-acre site at 2916 N Miami Avenue for $11.5 million in 2016 and landed a $76 million construction loan from 3650 REIT in 2020, before the pandemic hit.
Now, Wilmington Trust is alleging R&B Realty Group stopped making payments on the newest loan in December 2023.
The lawsuit also goes after a 5,187-square-foot retail building across the street from The Gateway at Wynwood that’s leased to Chase Bank. R&B Realty Group, which is owned and run by the Rosenberg family, purchased the single-story property for $7.4 million in 2015, according to property records.
A representative for R&B Realty Group did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
The Gateway at Wynwood made headlines for attracting high-profile tech tenants such as OpenStore, founded by tech entrepreneur Keith Rabois. Private equity firm Thoma Bravo, brokerage Marcus & Millichap, biopharmaceutical company Veru, and coworking provider Mindspace later joined.
At the time A10 Capital originated the loan, the property was 66 percent leased, according to a report by Morningstar.
The foreclosure suit against Gateway at Wynwood may be a sign of Miami’s softening office market. The pandemic heydey — when a slew of new-to-market tenants decamped to the Magic City and 830 Brickell broke records for nabbing rents above $100 a square foot — appears to be over.
Just this month, The Wall Street Journal reported that Related Companies and Swire Properties had amended their agreement to build a 80-story office tower in Brickell after failing to secure an anchor tenant.
Julia Echikson can be reached at .

organizations.name: foreclosure suit gateway at wynwood office buildings facing

author: HeadTopics.com
title: Researchers gave AI bots their own social platform. It turned toxic.
text:
Business Insider tells the global tech, finance, stock market, media, economy, lifestyle, real estate, AI and innovative stories you want to know.
A team of researchers gave AI bots their own social platform — and it turned toxic.The chatbots split into cliques and boosted the most partisan voices. A handful of 'influencers' also quickly dominated the conversation, according to a study published last Tuesday by researchers at the University of Amsterdam.The researchers built a minimal social network with no ads, no recommended posts, and no algorithm deciding what users see.
The researchers also tested six interventions meant to break the polarization loop, including a chronological feed, downranking viral content, hiding follower counts, hiding user bios, and amplifying opposing views.None solved the problem. 'While several showed moderate positive effects, none fully addressed the core pathologies, and improvements in one dimension often came at the cost of worsening another,' the researchers said.

author: Megan Grisham
title: LIST: Country Stars' Adorable 2024 Christmas Family Photos
text:
Country Stars Share Their Christmas Cheer With Family Photos
Country stars shared their holiday cheer in 2024 with family photos that gave fans a peek into their festive celebrations. From moments spent with kids, partners, and even furry friends, their Christmas posts were filled with love and joy.
Here’s a look at some of the best Christmas family photos from country stars this year.
Brittany & Jason Aldean
Brittany and Jason Aldean are known for going all out when the holidays roll around. This year, Brittany shared an adorable carousel of photos featuring their two kids, Memphis (7) and Navy (6). The pictures capture the kids meeting Santa over the years.
View this post on Instagram
Jon Pardi
Jon Pardi shared a photo with his wife and two daughters, Sienna Grace (5 months) and Presley (2) this holiday season. The post shows what seems to be a Pardi tradition, with the family of four enjoying a drive together on a Can-Am on Christmas Day.
View this post on Instagram
Jessie James Decker
Country singer [Jessie James Decker](https://countrymusicfamily.com/jessie-james-decker-and-husband-welcome-baby-boy/) and her husband Eric shared a photo with their four kids this Christmas, featuring an exciting guest appearance from the iconic Dolly Parton.
In the photo, Decker, her husband, and their four kids, Denver, Vivianne, Eric Jr. “Bubby,” and Forrest, are all sitting alongside Dolly for a Christmas moment they will surely never forget.
View this post on Instagram
Parker McCollum
Parker McCollum and his wife Hallie had their very first Christmas as parents this year. The couple [welcomed a baby boy](https://countrymusicfamily.com/parker-mccollum-wife-hallie-welcome-baby-boy/), named Major, in August. For Christmas, they shared a sweet photo of them with their son who is sporting the cutest striped Christmas onesie.
View this post on Instagram
Gabby Barrett
Straight from releasing her first Christmas album in November, Gabby Barrett is continuing to show off her holiday spirit more than ever this year. [She and her husband](https://countrymusicfamily.com/gabby-barrett-defends-marriage-after-being-told-it-is-ruining-her-career/) Cole Foehner posed for a loving photo with their three children Ivy, Baylah, and Augustine. The family of five stood together in front of a very large Christmas tree with smiles on their faces.
View this post on Instagram
Ian Munsick
Ian Munsick spent his Christmas making memories with his son Crawford. The “Long Haul” singer shared multiple photos from his Christmas day, including some of his son opening presents, his wife, and his adorable puppy.
View this post on Instagram
Jana Kramer
Actress and country singer [Jana Kramer](https://countrymusicfamily.com/jana-kramer-marries-allan-russell-in-stunning-scottish-fairytale-wedding/) shared a few family photos that will melt your heart. She celebrated the holidays with her husband Allan Russell and three children Jolie (8), Jace (5), and Roman (1). In the series of photos, Kramer and her family are posing together and looking so happy to be experiencing quality time. The last picture she shared is a family Christmas card, which she typically creates every year.
View this post on Instagram
[RELATED: LIST- COUNTRY STARS WHO WELCOMED NEW BABIES IN 2024](https://countrymusicfamily.com/list-country-stars-who-welcomed-new-babies-in-2024/)
Mackenzie Porter
Canadian country singer MacKenzie Porter and her husband, Nashville actor Jake Etheridge, shared a family photo with their 8-month-old daughter Bowen. For her first Christmas, Bowen is wearing a super cute red and white outfit with a headband to match.
View this post on Instagram
Thomas Rhett & Lauren Akins
Thomas Rhett and his wife Lauren shared several photos of the fun they’ve had this holiday season. Some of the special moments include activities with their four daughters, Willa Gray (9), Ada James (7), Lennon Love (4), and Lillie Carolina (3), like decorating the Christmas tree and making gingerbread houses.
View this post on Instagram
